etymology.description: Pictogram of water flowing; sometimes written as the variant 氺; next to a character it is compressed and stylized into 氵 (unrelated to 冫).
etymology.interpretation: Depicts flowing water with a main stream and side droplets. In compound characters it condenses to the left-side form 氵 to signal a water-related meaning, distinct from 冫 which indicates ice or cold.

examples.chinese: 我想喝一杯水(我想喝一杯水)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng hē yì bēi shuǐ.
examples.english: I want to drink a glass of water.

examples.chinese: 城市的自来水很干净(城市的自來水很乾淨)。
examples.english: The tap water in the city is very clean.

examples.chinese: 旱季来了(旱季來了)，我们要节约用水(我們要節約用水)。
examples.pinyin: Hànjì lái le, wǒmen yào jiéyuē yòngshuǐ.
examples.english: The dry season has arrived; we should conserve water.
